Generation III.Ruby: Torchic sticks with its Trainer , following behind with unsteady steps. This Pok é mon breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees F , including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.
Generation III.Sapphire: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug - it will be glowing with warmth. This Pok é mon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
Generation III.Emerald: If attacked, it strikes back by spitting balls of fire it forms in its stomach. A Torchic dislikes darkness because it can't see its surroundings.
Generation III.FireRed: It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually burns. It feels warm if it is hugged.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually burns. It feels warm if it is hugged.

Generation IV.Diamond: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F .
Generation IV.Pearl: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F .
Generation IV.Platinum: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F .
Generation IV.HeartGold: Inside its body is a place where it keeps a small flame. Hug it! It will be as warm as a hot-water bottle.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Inside its body is a place where it keeps a small flame. Hug it! It will be as warm as a hot-water bottle.

Generation V.Black: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F .
Generation V.White: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F .
Generation V.Black 2: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F .
Generation V.White 2: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F .

Generation VI.X: It has a flame sac inside its belly that perpetually burns. It feels warm if it is hugged.
Generation VI.Y: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit .
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with unsteady steps. This Pokémon breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit , including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: A fire burns inside it, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit .
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: A fire burns inside it, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit .

Generation IX.Scarlet: Torchic feels toasty warm if you hug it. It has a flame sac inside its belly, and the flames burn continuously as long as Torchic has life in it.
Generation IX.Violet: In its belly, it has a sac filled with burning fire, meaning that Torchic feels as warm as a hot-water bottle if you hug it.

Generation III.Ruby: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101
Generation III.Sapphire: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101
Generation III.Emerald: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101

Generation IV.HeartGold: Received from Steven Stone in Silph Co. after defeating Red
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Received from Steven Stone in Silph Co. after defeating Red

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Grand Underground - Sandsear Cave , Typhlo Cavern , Volcanic Cave (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Grand Underground - Sandsear Cave , Typhlo Cavern , Volcanic Cave (after obtaining the National Pokédex )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Polar Biome (after boosting biodiversity in the Polar Biome)
